result.execSummary:
The defendant Akeem J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Akeem J Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Akeem J Smith was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Akeem J Smith was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final pre-trial on February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

PLUS $5,000 CO-SIGNED BY BROTHER, BRANDON JOPLIN W/PHOTO I.D.
Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: **AMENDED**  Defendant must live with cousin Reginia Slack. No contact with the victims, IS, AST and JD (person, property, residence or family), or co-defendants. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Defendant may leave home for court, attorney appointments and work. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment. The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
11/4/14 - BOND MODIFIED TO ALLOW DEFENDANT RELEASE FOR WORK SEARCH: Between the hours of 8am-noon Mon., Wed. and Friday's at the Workforce Development Center, 1717 Taylor Ave., Racine.
